newsitem.title: USA: Amax sees early '97 Fort Knox mine production.
newsitem.headline: Amax sees early '97 Fort Knox mine production.

text.p: Amax Gold Inc said Wednesday that during December, it poured its first gold at the Fort Knox mine near Fairbanks, Alaska, and it expects commercial production in early 1997.

Fort Knox should reach full production by mid-1997 and the company said it anticipates producing at an annual rate of about 350,000 ounces at a cash cost of about $215 per ounce for the first five years of the mine life.
The company said it expects its 1997 production to be nearly 700,000 ounces with cash costs of around $220 per ounce.
The company said its Guanaco mine set a quarterly production record by producing 31,323 ounces in the 1996 fourth quarter, more than double 1995 fourth quarter production.

Amax Gold said its capital spending will be significantly reduced in 1997 and cash flow from operations should be sufficient to satisfy its cash needs. Early in 1997, the company said it will consider various options to restructure its debt and capital and this could include accessing public debt and equity markets.
